allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

details.flavorText:
Bronze dragons are among the most common of metallic dragons and the most likely to ally with mortals on worthy quests. However, they are naturally scholarly creatures who would rather remain in their lairs studying esoteric lore than go off on a wild adventure. These aloof and stoic dragons also act as preservationists, guarding storehouses of ancient lore from destruction or perversion. Bronze dragons are principled and protective, but while their silver cousins are quick to crusade for justice, bronze dragons prefer to find an important location worthy of their protection and guard it against any attack or unwelcome intrusion.

Bronze dragons' mastery over water and affinity for electricity means they are a boon to sailors caught in thunderstorms. A bronze dragon's enemies quickly discover neither cloudy sky nor turbulent sea provides shelter from their wrath. Bronze dragons lair along shorelines, often in partially submerged sea caves.

While all dragons keep hoards of treasure, the hoard of a bronze dragon more resembles a vast library-with the shelves kept carefully above the waterline, of course. In addition to their collections of esoteric lore, bronze dragons keep treasures associated with the sea, such as beautiful scrimshaw, flawless pearls, and equipment inlaid with mother-of-pearl and abalone shell.
details.sidebarText:
Bronze Dragon Spellcasters

Bronze dragon spellcasters tend to cast the following spells.

Young Bronze Dragon
Arcane Prepared Spells DC 28, attack +21; 4th @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Dimension Door]{Dimension Door}, solid fog; 3rd dispel magic, mind reading, slow; 2nd comprehend language, mirror image, resist energy; 1st alarm, hydraulic push, true strike; Cantrips @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Detect Magic]{Detect Magic}, light, message, read aura, shield

Adult Bronze Dragon
Arcane Prepared Spells DC 33, attack +27; As young bronze dragon, plus 6th mislead, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.True Seeing]{True Seeing}; 5th control water, illusory scene, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Tongues]{Tongues}; 4th @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Suggestion]{Suggestion}; Cantrips @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Detect Magic]{Detect Magic}, light, message, read aura, shield

Tiruvinn

Reclusive and secretive, this adult bronze dragon sometimes speaks to adventurers. That’s how he came to meet Ameiko Kaijitsu, who named Sandpoint’s Rusty Dragon tavern after him.

description.label: Description
description.value: You call forth a cloud of mist. All creatures within the mist become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} to creatures within it. You can Dismiss the cloud.

description.label: Description
description.value: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn't make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

10 feet, [[/r 1d12 # electricity damage]] electricity damage. The bronze dragon can turn this aura on or off using a single action, which has the concentrate trait, and it can choose to not affect allies with the aura.

90 feet, DC 31
A creature that first enters the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this monster's Frightful Presence for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected by the presence.
Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 1.
Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 2.
Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 4.

Jaws only. Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using. Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

The bronze dragon breathes in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds.
  • Lightning The dragon breathes lightning in a 80-foot line that deals [[/r 8d12 # electricity damage]] electricity damage (DC 33 basic Reflex save).
  • Repulsion Gas The dragon breathes a 80-foot line of repulsive gas. Each creature in the area must succeed at a DC 33 Will save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fleeing]{Fleeing} from the dragon for 1 round (or 2 rounds on a critical failure).
The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.
When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, it recharges its Breath Weapon.
For up to 60 minutes per day, the dragon, along with allied creatures and vessels within 50 feet, can move at double their normal Speed in water.
